column4: hey guys, I cant seem to get gmail to work with ubuntu, wondering if anything is wrong, all other sites seem to work, including www.google.com, are the gmail servers down?
what ahppens when you go to the site?
close all isntances of firefox, run firefox in a terminal with 'firefox -safe-mode' and see if gmail works
really, what version?
I'm pretty sure it
it booted into safe mode, I'm logging in right now
I'm pretty sure it's been -safe-mode for a while, what does it say when you try?  invalid option?
I did --safe-mode and it worked
I'm trying to log into gmail right now
probably not, I have used it fine with dial-up
does google's html mode work?
I dont know how to access that without getting onto the inbox
the link for me is: http://mail.google.com/mail/?ui=html&zy=f
I'm trying that link right now
its doing the same thing as the other link
it worked it worked!
now only if you could figure out why standard doesn't work... seems like it's javascript related.  But since it didn't work in safe mode it means it probably isn't a setting or extension issue
I dont know, it didnt have the link to go to normal mode on the top like it usually does when you are in html, I just reinstalled firefox so I had to close it down but I am opening it back up now
maybe it's the chat feature, that happens to coincide with the timing
it works really fast now, I dont know what gives, maybe it happened when I reinstalled java and didnt restart firefox
oh, maybe
I've been using ubuntu full time for 3 months now, it was difficult to get dial-up to work for me
yeah, when I'm home I have to use windows.  My modem driver costs like 15 bucks a year which I am not going to pay
you have gaim in applications menu > internet
